intro: Phlomoides alaica, commonly known as the Alaska phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of pale blue to purple flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phlomoides alaica is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils in tundra environments.
